intro: Koanophyllon pachyneurum, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous, leafy stems. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and early summer.
